alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:18AM CST until January 26 at 5:20PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Tombigbee River at Bigbee ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Tombigbee River near Amory Buttahatchie River near Buttahatchie River near Aberdeen For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Tombigbee River at Bigbee, Tombigbee River near Amory, Tombigbee River Aberdeen L & D... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Buttahatchie River...including Buttahatchie River near Aberdeen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Most lowland and farm land near the river is flooded. Equipment and livestock may need to be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM CST Thursday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 AM CST Thursday was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage early this morning to 19.5 feet this afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage this afternoon to 22.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage again late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 130 PM CST.
